title: Authors and Citation
text: Daniel P. Smith. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Smith D (2025). h5lite: Simplified 'HDF5' Interface. R package version 2.0.0.0, https://github.com/cmmr/h5lite.
code: @Manual{,   title = {h5lite: Simplified 'HDF5' Interface},   author = {Daniel P. Smith},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 2.0.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/cmmr/h5lite}, }

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: h5lite R package provides simple lightweight interface reading writing HDF5 files. designed R users want save load common R objects (vectors, factors, matrices, data.frames, lists, NULLs) HDF5 file without needing understand low-level details HDF5 library.

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: h5lite “opinionated” software prioritizes simplicity safety common use cases. handles tricky parts HDF5 automatically can focus data. Simple, R-native API: Use familiar functions like h5_read() h5_write(). need learn complex new syntax. Dimensions handled automatically. R matrices saved matrices read back matrices. Parent groups created needed (e.g., writing "group/data" works even "group" doesn’t exist). Writing existing dataset path overwrites , just like re-assigning variable. Auto-selects safe R data type numeric data prevent overflow. Automatic data type selection saves space default (e.g., 1:100 stored 8-bit integer). Built-, easy--use compression (compress = TRUE). Easy Installation: h5lite bundles HDF5 dependency, installation simple install.packages("h5lite"). need manage system libraries. package uses HDF5 library developed HDF Group (https://www.hdfgroup.org/).

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: can install released version h5lite CRAN: Alternatively, can install development version GitHub:
code: install.packages("h5lite") # install.packages("devtools")   devtools::install_github("cmmr/h5lite")

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: API designed simple predictable.
code: library(h5lite)  file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: Use h5_write() save R objects. automatically handles dimensions chooses efficient -disk data type. also acts unified writer datasets, groups (lists), attributes.
code: # Write a vector h5_write(1:10, file, "data/vector")  # Write an R matrix mat <- matrix(c(1:7, 8.5, NA, Inf), nrow = 2, ncol = 5) h5_write(mat, file, "data/matrix")  # Write a 3D array arr <- array(1L:24L, dim = c(2, 3, 4)) h5_write(arr, file, "data/array")  # Write a scalar (wrap in I() to write as HDF5 scalar) h5_write(I("Hello!"), file, "scalar_string")  # Write a factor fac <- as.factor(c("a", "b", "a", "c")) h5_write(fac, file, "factor_data")  # Write a data.frame (as a compound dataset) h5_write(mtcars, file, "mtcars")  # Write a list (recursively creates groups and datasets) h5_write(list(a = 1, b = 2), file, "config")

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: Use h5_ls() see file structure character vector, h5_str() formatted preview.
code: # List all objects recursively h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE) #> [1] "data"          "data/vector"   "data/matrix"   "data/array" #> [5] "scalar_string" "factor_data"   "config"        "config/a" #> [9] "config/b"      "mtcars"  # Preview the file structure (like h5ls -r) h5_str(file) #> / #> ├── data #> │   ├── vector <uint8 x 10> #> │   ├── matrix <float64 x 2 x 5> #> │   └── array <uint8 x 2 x 3 x 4> #> ├── scalar_string <string scalar> #> ├── factor_data <enum x 4> #> ├── config #> │   ├── a <uint8 x 1> #> │   └── b <uint8 x 1> #> └── mtcars <compound × 32 × 11>

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: Use h5_read() read data back R. function automatically restores correct dimensions.
code: # Read the matrix mat_in <- h5_read(file, "data/matrix") all.equal(mat, mat_in) #> [1] TRUE

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: Metadata can attached object using attr parameter.
code: # Attach attributes to the "data/matrix" dataset h5_write(I("meters"), file, "data/matrix", attr = "units") h5_write(c(1.0, 1.0), file, "data/matrix", attr = "scale")  # List attributes h5_attr_names(file, "data/matrix") #> [1] "units" "scale"  # Read an attribute units <- h5_read(file, "data/matrix", attr = "units") print(units) #> [1] "meters"

title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: detailed guides specific topics, see package vignettes: Getting Started h5lite: general introduction. Working Atomic Vectors: Details vectors scalars. Working Matrices Arrays: Handling multi-dimensional data. Working Data Frames: Using compound datasets. Data Organization: Using groups lists structure files. Attributes -Depth: deep dive metadata handling. Object-Oriented Interface: guide h5_open() handle streamlined workflow. Using h5lite Parallel Processing: Guide multi-threaded multi-process access. can also access vignettes within R using browseVignettes("h5lite").

what: When to Use Another HDF5 Package
title: Simplified HDF5 Interface
text: h5lite intentionally simple. need advanced control HDF5 features, use comprehensive package like rhdf5 (Bioconductor) hdf5r (CRAN). Use rhdf5 hdf5r need : - Work complex custom HDF5 data types supported h5lite (e.g., bitfields, references). - fine-grained control file properties, chunking, compression filters. - Perform partial /O (.e., read write small slice large -disk dataset). Use h5lite want : - Quickly safely get data file. - Avoid thinking low-level details.

text: Lists names attributes attached specific HDF5 object.

code: h5_attr_names(file, name = "/")

title: List HDF5 Attributes — h5_attr_names
text: file path HDF5 file. name path object (dataset group) query. Use / file's root attributes.

title: List HDF5 Attributes — h5_attr_names
text: character vector attribute names.

title: List HDF5 Attributes — h5_attr_names
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(1:10,          file, "data") h5_write(I("meters"),   file, "data", attr = "unit") h5_write(I(Sys.time()), file, "data", attr = "timestamp")  h5_attr_names(file, "data") #> [1] "unit"      "timestamp"  unlink(file)

what: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_class
title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_class
text: Inspects HDF5 object (attribute attached ) returns R class h5_read() produce.

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_class
code: h5_class(file, name, attr = NULL)

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_class
text: file path HDF5 file. name full path object (group dataset) check. attr name attribute check. NULL (default), function checks class object .

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_class
text: character string representing R class (e.g., "numeric", "complex", "character", "factor", "raw", "list", "NULL"). Returns NA_character_ HDF5 types h5lite read.

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_class
text: function determines resulting R class inspecting storage metadata. Groups reported "list". Integer/Float datasets/attributes reported "numeric". String datasets/attributes reported "character". Complex datasets/attributes reported "complex". Enum datasets/attributes reported "factor". 1-byte Opaque datasets/attributes reported "raw". Compound datasets/attributes reported "data.frame". Null datasets/attributes (null dataspace) reported "NULL".

title: Get R Class of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_class
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(1:10, file, "dset") h5_class(file, "dset") # "numeric" #> [1] "numeric" unlink(file)

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
text: Explicitly creates new, empty HDF5 file.

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
code: h5_create_file(file)

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
text: file Path HDF5 file created.

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effects.

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
text: function simple wrapper around h5_create_group(file, "/"). main purpose allow explicit file creation code. Note calling function almost always unnecessary, h5lite writing functions (like h5_write() h5_create_group()) automatically create file exist. provided convenience users prefer explicitly create file writing data .

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
text: file exist, created new, empty HDF5 file. file already exists valid HDF5 file, function nothing returns successfully. file exists valid HDF5 file (e.g., text file), error thrown file modified.

title: Create an HDF5 File — h5_create_file
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # Explicitly create the file h5_create_file(file)  if (file.exists(file)) {   message("File created successfully.") } #> File created successfully.  unlink(file)

title: Create an HDF5 Group — h5_create_group
text: Explicitly creates new group (nested groups) HDF5 file. useful creating empty group structure.

title: Create an HDF5 Group — h5_create_group
code: h5_create_group(file, name)

title: Create an HDF5 Group — h5_create_group
text: file path HDF5 file. name full path group create (e.g., "/g1/g2").

title: Create an HDF5 Group — h5_create_group
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effects.

title: Create an HDF5 Group — h5_create_group
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_create_file(file)  # Create a nested group structure h5_create_group(file, "/data/experiment/run1") h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE) #> [1] "data"                 "data/experiment"      "data/experiment/run1"  unlink(file)

what: Delete an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_delete
title: Delete an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_delete
text: Deletes object (dataset group) attribute HDF5 file. object attribute exist, warning issued function returns successfully (error raised).

title: Delete an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_delete
code: h5_delete(file, name, attr = NULL, warn = TRUE)

title: Delete an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_delete
text: file path HDF5 file. name full path object delete (e.g., "/data/dset" "/groups/g1"). attr name attribute delete. NULL (default), object specified name deleted. string provided, attribute named attr removed object name. warn Emit warning name/attr exist. Default: TRUE

title: Delete an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_delete
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effects.

title: Delete an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_delete
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_create_file(file)  # Create some data and attributes h5_write(matrix(1:10, 2, 5), file, "matrix") h5_write("A note", file, "matrix", attr = "note")  # Delete the attribute h5_delete(file, "matrix", attr = "note") h5_attr_names(file, "matrix") # Returns character(0) #> character(0)  # Delete the dataset h5_delete(file, "matrix") h5_ls(file) # Returns character(0) #> character(0)  # Cleaning up unlink(file)

what: Get Dimensions of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_dim
title: Get Dimensions of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_dim
text: Returns dimensions dataset attribute integer vector. dimensions match R-style (column-major) interpretation.

title: Get Dimensions of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_dim
code: h5_dim(file, name, attr = NULL)

title: Get Dimensions of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_dim
text: file path HDF5 file. name Name dataset object. attr name attribute check. NULL (default), function returns dimensions object .

title: Get Dimensions of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_dim
text: integer vector dimensions, integer(0) scalars.

title: Get Dimensions of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_dim
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(matrix(1:10, 2, 5), file, "matrix") h5_dim(file, "matrix") # 2 5 #> [1] 2 5 unlink(file)

what: Check if an HDF5 File, Object, or Attribute Exists — h5_exists
title: Check if an HDF5 File, Object, or Attribute Exists — h5_exists
text: Safely checks file, object within file, attribute object exists.

title: Check if an HDF5 File, Object, or Attribute Exists — h5_exists
code: h5_exists(file, name = "/", attr = NULL, assert = FALSE)

title: Check if an HDF5 File, Object, or Attribute Exists — h5_exists
text: file Path file. name full path object check (e.g., "/data/matrix"). Defaults "/" test file validity. attr name attribute check. provided, function tests existence attribute name. assert Logical. TRUE target exist, function stop informative error message instead returning FALSE. Defaults FALSE.

title: Check if an HDF5 File, Object, or Attribute Exists — h5_exists
text: logical value: TRUE target exists valid, FALSE otherwise.

title: Check if an HDF5 File, Object, or Attribute Exists — h5_exists
text: function provides robust, error-free way test existence. Testing File: name / attr NULL, function checks file valid, readable HDF5 file. Testing Object: name path (e.g., /data/matrix) attr NULL, function checks specific object exists. Testing Attribute: attr provided, function checks attribute exists specified object name.

title: Check if an HDF5 File, Object, or Attribute Exists — h5_exists
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_create_file(file) h5_exists(file) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE h5_exists(file, "missing_object") # FALSE #> [1] FALSE unlink(file)

what: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
text: Checks object given path dataset.

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
code: h5_is_dataset(file, name, attr = NULL)

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
text: file path HDF5 file. name full path object check. attr name attribute. provided, function returns TRUE attribute exists, attributes considered datasets HDF5 context. (Default: NULL)

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
text: logical value: TRUE object exists dataset, FALSE otherwise (group, exist).

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Dataset — h5_is_dataset
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(1, file, "dset") h5_is_dataset(file, "dset") # TRUE #> [1] TRUE unlink(file)

what: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
text: Checks object given path group.

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
code: h5_is_group(file, name, attr = NULL)

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
text: file path HDF5 file. name full path object check. attr name attribute. parameter included consistency functions. Since attributes groups, providing always return FALSE. (Default: NULL)

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
text: logical value: TRUE object exists group, FALSE otherwise (dataset, exist).

title: Check if an HDF5 Object is a Group — h5_is_group
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_create_group(file, "grp") h5_is_group(file, "grp") # TRUE #> [1] TRUE unlink(file)

what: Get the Total Length of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_length
title: Get the Total Length of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_length
text: Returns total number elements dataset, attribute, group. Datasets Attributes, product dimensions (total number elements). Groups, number objects directly contained group (similar length() list). Scalar datasets attributes return 1.

title: Get the Total Length of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_length
code: h5_length(file, name, attr = NULL)

title: Get the Total Length of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_length
text: file path HDF5 file. name full path object (group dataset). attr name attribute check. provided, length attribute returned.

title: Get the Total Length of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_length
text: integer representing total length (number elements).

title: Get the Total Length of an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_length
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(1:100, file, "dset") h5_length(file, "dset") # 100 #> [1] 100 unlink(file)

title: List HDF5 Objects — h5_ls
text: Lists names objects (datasets groups) within HDF5 file group.

title: List HDF5 Objects — h5_ls
code: h5_ls(file, name = "/", recursive = TRUE, full.names = FALSE, scales = FALSE)

title: List HDF5 Objects — h5_ls
text: file path HDF5 file. name group path start listing . Defaults root group (/). recursive TRUE (default), lists objects found recursively name. FALSE, lists immediate children. full.names TRUE, full paths file's root returned. FALSE (default), names relative name. scales TRUE, also returns datasets dimensions scales datasets.

title: List HDF5 Objects — h5_ls
text: character vector object names. name / (default), paths relative root file. name another group, paths relative group (unless full.names = TRUE).

title: List HDF5 Objects — h5_ls
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_create_group(file, "foo/bar") h5_write(1:5, file, "foo/data")  # List everything recursively h5_ls(file) #> [1] "foo"      "foo/bar"  "foo/data"  # List only top-level objects h5_ls(file, recursive = FALSE) #> [1] "foo"  # List relative to a sub-group h5_ls(file, "foo") #> [1] "bar"  "data"  unlink(file)

what: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
text: Moves renames object (dataset, group, etc.) within HDF5 file.

title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
code: h5_move(file, from, to)

title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
text: file path HDF5 file. current (source) path object (e.g., "/group/data"). new (destination) path object (e.g., "/group/data_new").

title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
text: function called side-effect returns NULL invisibly.

title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
text: function provides efficient, low-level wrapper HDF5 library's H5Lmove function. metadata-operation, meaning data read rewritten. makes extremely fast, even large datasets. can use function either rename object within group (e.g., "data/old" "data/new") move object different group (e.g., "data/old" "archive/old"). destination parent group automatically created exist.

title: Move or Rename an HDF5 Object — h5_move
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(1:10, file, "group/dataset")  # Rename within the same group h5_move(file, "group/dataset", "group/renamed") h5_ls(file) #> [1] "group"         "group/renamed"  # Move to a new group (creates parent automatically) h5_move(file, "group/renamed", "archive/dataset") h5_ls(file, recursive = TRUE) #> [1] "group"           "archive"         "archive/dataset"  unlink(file)

what: Get Names of an HDF5 Object — h5_names
title: Get Names of an HDF5 Object — h5_names
text: Returns names object. Groups, returns names objects contained group (similar ls()). Compound Datasets (data.frames), returns column names. Datasets, looks dimension scale returns found.

title: Get Names of an HDF5 Object — h5_names
code: h5_names(file, name = "/", attr = NULL)

title: Get Names of an HDF5 Object — h5_names
text: file path HDF5 file. name full path object. attr name attribute. provided, returns names associated attribute (e.g., field names attribute compound type). (Default: NULL)

title: Get Names of an HDF5 Object — h5_names
text: character vector names, NULL object names.

title: Get Names of an HDF5 Object — h5_names
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(data.frame(x=1, y=2), file, "df") h5_names(file, "df") # "x" "y" #> [1] "x" "y" unlink(file)

what: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
title: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
text: Creates file handle provides convenient, object-oriented interface interacting navigating specific HDF5 file.

title: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
code: h5_open(file)

title: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
text: file Path HDF5 file. file created exist.

title: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
text: object class h5 methods interacting file.

title: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
text: function returns special h5 object wraps standard h5lite functions. primary benefit file argument pre-filled, allowing concise readable code performing multiple operations file. example, instead writing:   can create handle use methods. Note file argument omitted method calls:
code: h5_write(1:10, file, "dset1") h5_write(2:20, file, "dset2") h5_ls(file) h5 <- h5_open("my_file.h5") h5$write(1:10, "dset1") h5$write(2:20, "dset2") h5$ls() h5$close()

title: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
text: Unlike R objects, h5 handle environment. means passed reference. assign another variable (e.g., h5_alias <- h5), variables point handle. Modifying one (e.g., calling h5_alias$close()) also affect .

title: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
text: h5 object provides several ways interact HDF5 file:

title: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
text: h5lite functions (e.g., h5_read, h5_write, h5_ls) available methods h5 object, without h5_ prefix. example, h5$write(data, "dset") equivalent h5_write(data, file, "dset"). available methods : read, write, class, dim, exists, is_dataset, is_group, ls, names, str, typeof, create_group, attr_names, delete, move.

title: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
text: handle maintains internal working directory simplify path management. h5$cd(group): Changes handle's internal working directory. stateful, pass--reference operation. understands absolute paths (e.g., "/new/path") relative navigation (e.g., "../"). target group need exist. h5$pwd(): Returns current working directory. call method like h5$read("dset"), handle automatically prepends current working directory relative path. provide absolute path (e.g., h5$read("/path//dset")), working directory ignored.

title: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
text: h5lite package keep files persistently open. operation opens, modifies, closes file. Therefore, h5$close() method perform action HDF5 file . purpose invalidate handle, preventing operations called. h5$close() called, subsequent method call (e.g., h5$ls()) throw error.

title: Create an HDF5 File Handle — h5_open
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # Open the handle h5 <- h5_open(file)  # Write data (note: 'data' is the first argument, 'file' is implicit) h5$write(1:5, "vector") h5$write(matrix(1:9, 3, 3), "matrix")  # Create a group and navigate to it h5$create_group("simulations") h5$cd("simulations") print(h5$pwd()) # "/simulations" #> [1] "/simulations"  # Write data relative to the current working directory h5$write(rnorm(10), "run1") # Writes to /simulations/run1  # Read data dat <- h5$read("run1")  # List contents of current WD h5$ls() #> [1] "run1"  # Close the handle h5$close() unlink(file)

what: Read an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_read
title: Read an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_read
text: Reads dataset, group, specific attribute HDF5 file R object.

title: Read an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_read
code: h5_read(file, name = "/", attr = NULL, as = "auto")

title: Read an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_read
text: file path HDF5 file. name full path dataset group read (e.g., "/data/matrix"). attr name attribute read. NULL (default), function reads object specified name (attaches attributes result). provided (string), function reads specified attribute name. target R data type. Global: "auto" (default), "integer", "double", "logical", "bit64", "null". Specific: named vector mapping names type classes R types (see Section "Type Conversion").

title: Read an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_read
text: R object corresponding HDF5 object attribute. Returns NULL object skipped via = "null".

title: Read an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_read
text: @ prefix used configure attached attributes reading dataset (attr = NULL). reading specific attribute directly (e.g., h5_read(..., attr = "id")), use @ prefix argument.

title: Read an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_read
text: can control HDF5 data converted R types using argument. 1. Mapping Name: = c("data_col" = "integer"): Reads dataset/column named "data_col" integer. = c("@validated" = "logical"): reading dataset, forces attached attribute "validated" read logical. 2. Mapping HDF5 Type Class: can target specific HDF5 data types using keys prefixed dot (.). Supported classes include: Integer: .int, .int8, .int16, .int32, .int64 Unsigned: .uint, .uint8, .uint16, .uint32, .uint64 Floating Point: .float, .float16, .float32, .float64 Example: = c(.uint8 = "logical", .int = "bit64") 3. Precedence & Attribute Config: Attributes vs Datasets: Attribute type mappings take precedence dataset mappings. specify = c(.uint = "logical", "@.uint" = "integer"), unsigned integer datasets read logical, unsigned integer attributes read integer. Specific vs Generic: Specific keys (e.g., .uint32) take precedence generic keys (e.g., .uint), take precedence global default (.).

title: Read an HDF5 Object or Attribute — h5_read
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # --- Write Data --- h5_write(c(10L, 20L), file, "ints") h5_write(I(TRUE),     file, "ints", attr = "ready") h5_write(c(10.5, 18), file, "floats") h5_write(I("meters"), file, "floats", attr = "unit")  # --- Read Data --- # Read dataset x <- h5_read(file, "ints") print(x) #> [1] 10 20 #> attr(,"ready") #> [1] 1  # Read dataset with attributes y <- h5_read(file, "floats") print(attr(y, "unit")) #> [1] "meters"  # Read a specific attribute directly unit <- h5_read(file, "floats", attr = "unit") print(unit) #> [1] "meters"  # --- Type Conversion Examples ---  # Force integer dataset to be read as numeric (double) x_dbl <- h5_read(file, "ints", as = "double") class(x_dbl) #> [1] "numeric"  # Force attached attribute to be read as logical # Note the "@" prefix to target the attribute # h5_read(file, "ints", as = c("@ready" = "logical"))  unlink(file)

what: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
text: Recursively prints summary HDF5 group dataset, similar structure h5ls -r. displays nested structure, object types, dimensions, attributes.

title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
code: h5_str(file, name = "/", attrs = TRUE)

title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
text: file path HDF5 file. name name group dataset display. Defaults root group "/". attrs Set FALSE groups datasets. default (TRUE) shows attributes well.

title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
text: function called side-effect printing console returns NULL invisibly.

title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
text: function provides quick convenient way inspect contents HDF5 file. performs recursive traversal file C-level prints formatted summary R console. function read data R. inspects metadata (names, types, dimensions) objects file, making fast memory-safe arbitrarily large files.

title: Display the Structure of an HDF5 Object — h5_str
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(list(x = 1:10, y = matrix(1:9, 3, 3)), file, "group") h5_write("metadata", file, "group", attr = "info")  # Print structure h5_str(file) #> / #> └── group #>     ├── @info <string × 1> #>     ├── x <uint8 × 10> #>     └── y <uint8 × 3 × 3>  unlink(file)

title: Get HDF5 Storage Type of an Object or Attribute — h5_typeof
code: h5_typeof(file, name, attr = NULL)

title: Get HDF5 Storage Type of an Object or Attribute — h5_typeof
text: file path HDF5 file. name Name dataset object. attr name attribute check. NULL (default), function returns type object .

title: Get HDF5 Storage Type of an Object or Attribute — h5_typeof
text: character string representing HDF5 storage type (e.g., "float32", "uint32", "string").

title: Get HDF5 Storage Type of an Object or Attribute — h5_typeof
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5") h5_write(1L, file, "int32_val", as = "int32") h5_typeof(file, "int32_val") # "int32" #> [1] "int32" unlink(file)

what: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: Writes R object HDF5 file, creating file exist. function acts unified writer datasets, groups (lists), attributes.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
code: h5_write(data, file, name, attr = NULL, as = "auto", compress = TRUE)

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: data R object write. Supported: numeric, integer, complex, logical, character, factor, raw, matrix, data.frame, NULL, nested lists. file path HDF5 file. name name dataset group write (e.g., "/data/matrix"). attr name attribute write. NULL (default), data written dataset group path name. provided (string), data written attribute named attr attached object name. target HDF5 data type. Can one "auto", "float16", "float32", "float64", "int8", "int16", "int32", "int64", "uint8", "uint16", "uint32", "uint64", "skip". default, "auto", selects space-efficient type data. See details . compress logical integer 0-9. TRUE, compression level 5 used. FALSE 0, compression used. integer 1-9 specifies zlib compression level directly.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: Invisibly returns file. function called side effects.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: default, h5_write saves single-element vectors 1-dimensional arrays. write true HDF5 scalar, wrap value () treat "-." example, h5_write((5), file, "x") create scalar dataset, h5_write(5, file, "x") create 1D array length 1.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: data list (data.frame), h5_write write recursively, creating corresponding group dataset structure. R list objects created HDF5 groups. supported R objects (vectors, matrices, arrays, factors, data.frames) written HDF5 datasets. Attributes list written HDF5 attributes corresponding group. writing, "dry run" performed validate objects attributes within list writeable type. part structure invalid, function throw error data written.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: data NULL, h5_write create HDF5 null dataset. dataset null dataspace, contains data.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: data.frame objects written HDF5 compound datasets. native HDF5 table-like structure highly efficient portable.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: h5lite writes R complex objects using native HDF5 H5T_COMPLEX datatype class, introduced HDF5 version 2.0.0. result, HDF5 files containing complex numbers written h5lite can read HDF5 tools support HDF5 version 2.0.0 later.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: POSIXt objects automatically converted character strings ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ). ensures timestamps stored human-readable unambiguous way. conversion applies standalone POSIXt objects, well columns within data.frame.

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
text: argument controls -disk storage type applies integer, numeric, logical vectors. data types (character, complex, factor, raw), storage type determined automatically. argument can one following: Global: single string, e.g., "auto" (default), "float32", "int64". Specific: named vector mapping names type classes HDF5 types. Matches h5_read behavior: "col_name" = "type": Specific dataset/column. "@attr_name" = "type": Specific attached attribute. ".int" = "type": Class-based (e.g., .int, .double, .logical). "." = "type": Global default fallback. set "auto" (default), h5lite automatically select space-efficient HDF5 type based following rules: data contains fractional values (e.g., 1.5), stored float64. data contains NA, NaN, Inf, stored using smallest floating-point type (float16, float32, float64) can precisely represent integer values vector. data contains finite integers (includes logical vectors, FALSE 0 TRUE 1), h5lite selects smallest possible integer type (e.g., uint8, int16). integer values exceed R's safe integer range (+/- 2^53), automatically stored float64 preserve precision. override automatic behavior, can specify exact type. full list supported values : "auto", "skip" "float16", "float32", "float64" "int8", "int16", "int32", "int64" "uint8", "uint16", "uint32", "uint64"

title: Write an R Object to HDF5 — h5_write
code: file <- tempfile(fileext = ".h5")  # 1. Writing Basic Datasets h5_write(1:10, file, "data/integers") h5_write(rnorm(10), file, "data/floats") h5_write(letters[1:5], file, "data/chars")  # 2. Writing Attributes # Write an object first h5_write(1:10, file, "data/vector") # Attach an attribute to it using the 'attr' parameter h5_write("My Description", file, "data/vector", attr = "description") h5_write(100, file, "data/vector", attr = "scale_factor")  # 3. Writing Complex Structures (Lists/Groups) my_list <- list(   meta = list(id = 1, name = "Experiment A"),   results = matrix(runif(9), 3, 3),   valid = TRUE ) h5_write(my_list, file, "experiment_1")  # 4. Writing Data Frames (Compound Datasets) df <- data.frame(   id = 1:5,   score = c(10.5, 9.2, 8.4, 7.1, 6.0),   grade = factor(c("A", "A", "B", "C", "D")) ) h5_write(df, file, "records/scores")  # 5. Controlling Data Types (Compression) # Store integers as 8-bit unsigned h5_write(1:5, file, "compressed/small_ints", as = "uint8")  unlink(file)

what: h5lite: A Simple and Lightweight HDF5 Interface — h5lite-package
title: h5lite: A Simple and Lightweight HDF5 Interface — h5lite-package
text: h5lite package provides simple, lightweight, user-friendly interface reading writing HDF5 files. designed R users want save load common R objects (vectors, matrices, arrays, factors, data.frames) HDF5 file without needing understand low-level details HDF5 C API.

title: h5lite: A Simple and Lightweight HDF5 Interface — h5lite-package
text: Simple API: Use familiar functions like h5_read() h5_write(). Automatic Handling: Dimensions, data types, group creation handled automatically. Safe Default: Auto-selects safe R data type numeric data prevent overflow. Easy Installation: required HDF5 library bundled package.

title: h5lite: A Simple and Lightweight HDF5 Interface — h5lite-package
text: Maintainer: Daniel P. Smith dansmith01@gmail.com
